input_text:
Job Title: Construction Project Director, Cleveland

Location: Cleveland, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About Bedrock

Bedrock is a full-service real estate firm specializing in innovative city building strategies. Since its founding in 2011, Bedrock and its affiliates have invested and committed more than $7.5 billion to acquire, develop and operate more than 140 properties in Detroit and Cleveland with landmark developments at the Hudson’s Site, Book Tower, City Modern, Tower City Center and the May Company Building.

Bedrock’s projects include new construction, adaptive reuse and a portfolio totaling more than 21 million square feet of office, retail, residential, industrial, hospitality and parking.

For additional information about Bedrock, please visit bedrockdetroit.com, our bedrockdetroit.com/careers/, and engage with us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn.

Position Summary

The Construction Project Director is responsible for driving construction projects from beginning to end, working in collaboration with the legal, acquisitions, finance, development, design, engineering, and property management teams. They will oversee all aspects of the construction process associated with Bedrock’s Cleveland portfolio. This position also provides leadership, establishes benchmarks, and monitors assigned projects to ensure completion in a cost-effective and timely manner.

Essential Funtions

Provides oversight of all assigned construction projects, ensuring adherence to budget and schedule through construction life cycleProvides construction input and representation through pre-development and pre-construction project phases, and provides full project management leadership through the construction phase, including but not limited to:Coordination with internal estimating team to provide cost feedbackEngagement in design process with development and architectural leads to provide feedback on cost and constructabilityProcurement, negotiation, and management of CM/GCMonitoring of design progress for adherence to approved budget and scheduleManagement of the design teamProviding clear and timely notification of budget or schedule deviation to leadershipCoordination with internal and external stakeholdersCost control, financial forecasting and managementContract management and contract closeoutOversees Construction & AE team throughout construction. Conducts regular site visits and inspections to coordinate with the Construction and AE team, verifying compliance with approved project plans and specificationsDevelops and maintains strategic business relationships with city, state, and federal agenciesMonitors the construction team’s management so that in-progress and archival project records are being kept in an orderly manner, including but not limited to correspondence, construction documents, contract and project administration documents, budget reports, construction change directives, reports, and meeting minutesProvides leadership to all direct reports including but not limited to coaching, professional development, and establishing and maintaining team goalsAll other duties as assigned

LEADERSHIP

Drive the culture: Communicates the culture’s value to team members and holds them accountable to living it every day Develop People: Set clear expectations, deliver timely and effective feedback, and encourage team members to develop their talents Build Trust: Demonstrate a high degree of integrity by honoring commitments, telling the truth and respecting confidentiality appropriately Think Strategically: Clearly understand the business, lead the team through the problem-solving process and work on the business not just in the business Communicate Effectively: Recognize how words, tone and physiology impacts results, then adapt accordingly to gain buy-in and alignment for the team’s and organization’s vision 

Position Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in construction management, architecture, engineering, or a related field (required)10-15 years of construction management or related experience (required)Project management and budgeting experience (required)At least 5 years of leadership experience (required)Specialized experience or certification, license, or advanced degree in area of expertise (desired)

Position Qualifications

Excellent written and verbal communicationAdvanced problem-solving skillsAbility to integrate complex activities within designated function to achieve the organization’s strategic goals Ability to act independently and collaboratively and work well under pressureComfortable and confident in negotiation and conflict resolution 

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and may be modified periodically.

Disclaimer

This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive list of duties and responsibilities performed by persons assigned to this classification. It is not intended to limit or in any way modify the right of any supervisor or manager to assign, direct and control the work of employees under his/her supervision. All principal duties and responsibilities of this position are essential functions of the position. Job descriptions are reviewed on a regular basis and may be revised at any time. Revisions will be communicated to employees within the classification. This job description does not constitute a contract of employment; therefore, the company may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

Bedrock is an equal-opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Director
